Unleash Your Inner Vectors

Apps Used:

Your job is to draw your own image, scan it, then use Image Trace to vectorize it. Once it's vectors, use Live Paint and Edit Colours to create a total of three different colour variations.

This is a summative assignment

It evaluates your mastery of the skills in this instructional unit. This assignment contributes to your final grade in the course. You will earn a letter grade.

Your Grading System

Topics

  • Semester Start
  • Layers
  • Blend Modes
  • Adjustment Layers
  • Compositing
  • Tabs & Indents
  • Bullet & Number Lists
  • Build a Document
  • Pixels to Vectors
  • Unleash Your Inner Vectors
  • Graph Design
  • Graph Layout

Your Assignment

The subject of your sketch must be an original character. Don’t use someone else’s artwork. Make sure your sketch has closed strokes, like the piggie example we used in class. The goal here is to use the Image Trace function in Illustrator.

The process:

  • Scan or take a clear face-on photo with your phone. Place it on an artboard in Illustrator.
  • Image Trace your sketch.
  • Duplicate the traced image three times (for a total of 4 instances).
  • Create three colour themes at color.adobe.com. Apply them to one of your sketches.
  • You’ll finish with one un-coloured and three coloured instances of your sketch.

Zip-compress your folder, then submit on Brightspace.

Supplemental Links

  • Adobe: Image Trace
  • Adobe: Image Trace Video

What you'll submit:

Instructions

You need to provide all your work in an organized fashion.

Name your main Illustrator file:

Appleseed-Johnny-#-vectors.ai

Include the scan/photo of the original hand-rendered drawing + the cleaned up Photohsop image file.

Name the submission folder:

Appleseed-Johnny-#-vectors
Submit
